content.title: Particle Masses Compared to Planck Mass: The Hierarchy Problem
content.abstract: A worked comparison of elementary particle masses to the Planck mass m_P ≈ 2.18 × 10⁻⁸ kg ≈ 1.22 × 10¹⁹ GeV/c², revealing the vast hierarchy between quantum gravity scale and electroweak scale—one of the deepest mysteries in physics.
content.problem_statement: Compare the masses of elementary particles (electron, proton, Higgs, top quark) to the Planck mass. What does this reveal about the hierarchy problem?

step_1.title: Calculate Electron to Planck Mass Ratio
step_1.interpretation: The electron is 10²³ times lighter than the Planck mass!
step_1.significance: Gravitational self-energy of electron is negligible: E_grav ~ Gm_e²/r_e ~ 10⁻⁴⁵ m_e c²

step_2.title: Calculate Proton to Planck Mass Ratio
step_2.interpretation: The proton is about 10²⁰ times lighter than Planck mass
step_2.significance: Gravity between two protons is 10³⁶ times weaker than electromagnetic force

step_3.title: Calculate Higgs to Planck Mass Ratio
step_3.interpretation: The Higgs mass is 10¹⁷ times below the Planck scale
step_3.the_hierarchy_problem: Why is m_H so far below m_P? Quantum corrections should push m_H toward m_P, but it doesn't. This is THE hierarchy problem!
step_3.significance: Electroweak scale (v ~ 246 GeV) is mysteriously stable against quantum gravity corrections

step_4.title: Calculate Top Quark to Planck Mass Ratio
step_4.interpretation: The heaviest known particle is still 10¹⁷ times lighter than m_P
step_4.significance: Top quark has Yukawa coupling y_t ~ 1, the only 'natural' scale in Standard Model

discussion.hierarchy_problem_explained: The Standard Model Higgs mass receives quantum corrections from all heavy particles. These corrections scale as Δm_H² ~ Λ² where Λ is the energy cutoff. If Λ ~ m_P (the natural cutoff), then Δm_H ~ 10¹⁷ GeV, but observed m_H ~ 125 GeV. This requires incredible fine-tuning (1 part in 10³⁴) to cancel contributions—deeply unnatural.

proposed_solutions.mechanism: Bosonic and fermionic contributions cancel naturally
proposed_solutions.status: No SUSY particles found at LHC—constrained but not ruled out

proposed_solutions.mechanism: True Planck scale is lower (TeV scale); hierarchy is geometric dilution
proposed_solutions.status: Tested at LHC; no evidence for large extra dimensions

proposed_solutions.mechanism: Higgs is composite; no fundamental scalar to receive corrections
proposed_solutions.status: Tight constraints from LHC data on compositeness

proposed_solutions.mechanism: m_H is random; we exist because it allows complex chemistry
proposed_solutions.status: Philosophical controversy; some string landscape support

gravitational_coupling.interpretation: Ratio of gravitational to electromagnetic force between electrons
gravitational_coupling.meaning: Gravity is 10⁴⁵ times weaker than electromagnetism at atomic scales
gravitational_coupling.cosmic_consequence: If α_G were larger, stars would collapse to black holes quickly

key_results: All known particles have m << m_P (by factor 10¹⁷ to 10²³)
The mass hierarchy spans 23 orders of magnitude from electron to Planck
Higgs mass stability is the hierarchy problem—unsolved
Gravitational coupling α_G ~ 10⁻⁴⁵ explains gravity's weakness at atomic scales
Why electroweak scale << Planck scale remains a mystery

definitions_glossary.planck_mass: m_P = √(ℏc/G) ≈ 2.18 × 10⁻⁸ kg ≈ 1.22 × 10¹⁹ GeV/c², the mass scale where quantum gravity is important
definitions_glossary.hierarchy_problem: Why is the electroweak/Higgs scale (~ 100 GeV) so far below the Planck scale (10¹⁹ GeV)?
definitions_glossary.gravitational_coupling: α_G = (m/m_P)² = Gm²/(ℏc), dimensionless measure of gravitational strength
definitions_glossary.electroweak_scale: Energy scale ~ 246 GeV set by Higgs vacuum expectation value
definitions_glossary.fine_tuning: Requirement for parameters to be precisely chosen to avoid cancellation—considered unnatural

related.relationship: Fine structure constant is analogous dimensionless measure for EM

sources.citation: Particle Data Group (2024): Review of Particle Physics

validation.notes: All mass values from PDG 2024. Hierarchy problem discussion validated against standard treatments.

learning_objectives: Calculate ratios of particle masses to Planck mass
Understand the vast hierarchy between electroweak and Planck scales
Identify proposed solutions to the hierarchy problem
common_errors: Confusing mass and energy units (GeV/c² vs kg)
Thinking the hierarchy is just a large number—missing the fine-tuning issue
Not recognizing that Higgs mass stability is the core problem
